comments.body:
I am seeing junit failures in this test when run on j9.  Unfortunately the machine running these
tests had a number of problems so I don't know exactly when the issue started, but it has been happening at least 
since 11/12/2007.

IBM jvm results are available from:
http://db.apache.org/derby/derby_tests.html
http://people.apache.org/~fuzzylogic/derby_test_results/

windows results are pretty consistently posted, work is continuing on getting the linux results posted.

See following for first known example:
http://people.apache.org/~fuzzylogic/derby_test_results/main/derbymain/testlog/weme6.1/594394-suites.All_diff.txt

See following which shows failure continuous from 11/12
http://people.apache.org/~fuzzylogic/derby_test_results/main/derbymain/weme6.1_history.html

The test shuts down the engine to be able to reset the properties that control the derby error stream. When running in this jsr169 configuration connections are done through DataSource, and the DataSourceConnector in the test framework does not support shutting down the engine. I don't know why you can't shut down the engine through DataSourceConnector, but I am sure it's for a good reason.

So, I don't know how the test could be rewritten to not shut down the engine, or to avoid DataSource in this configuration, so I guess the only way forward is to avoid running this test with configurations that do not support DriverManager. Unless anyone has other suggestions I will go ahead and implement that change, requiring JDBC2 or 3 for this test to run.

comments.body:
I'm confused about why the test framework doesn't support
shutting down the engine. Is this a limitation of DataSourceConnector?
Or of DataSource itself?

comments.body:
Thank you for the tip, John.

Based on your suggestion I've implemented the shutEngine() method in DataSourceConnector, and I can now run the test successfully in a Java ME configuration.

I'll do some more testing in other configurations and submit a patch for this tomorrow.

This patch implements the shutEngine() method for DataSourceConnector, enabling the ErrorStream test to run successfully also on Java ME platforms.

I haven't tested the patch on j9, but it works on the phoneME advanced platform.
